Description: Rough brown ware bowl made of Nile silt pottery with many organic voids and limestone grit. Exterior brushed to smooth and soot stained grey brown. Interior is scraped to smooth with soot staining. Base is worn. Rim is irregularly pinched; residue remains on interior lip. Coils from manufacture are evident.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Rough Brown, RB19M. Found in the grave of a woman, close to her head.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 39; pl. 20.19M)
